comments:
I tried to specify the "Parse include path" for a closed remote project from 
the properties view.  

1.  Select the closed remote project
2.  right click and select properties
3.  select "Parse include path"
4.  click onto the browse button and I got an internal error.

I will attach the log.

Dave, do you want to take a look at this one...At line 114 of 
DataElementFileDialog, there is the following code:
	DataStore dataStore = _input.getDataStore();
This causes a null exception presumably because _input is null.

For some reason the parent of the project is null.  The parent gets passed into 
the file dialog but the dialog expects a non-null value.  I've added a check to 
see if the dialog input is null but the real problem needs more investigation.  
It seems that there is an intermittant problem with the project having no parent 
when remote.

I'm going to mark this as fixed, because the internal error should no longer 
happen.   The underlying problem is described in 10285.

Tried it again with last nite build.
I got an internal error with a different log:

After looking at this again, I realize that the browse button should not be 
visible for a remote project that is closed, as you can't browse the system when 
you're not connected to it.  I've made the needed changes for R1 and R2.
